title: 111_hr2217
content: The Act may be cited as the "Student Credit Card Transparency Act of 2009". It pertains to college credit card agreements. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding College Card Agreements, defining a college affinity card as a credit card issued in partnership with an institution of higher education. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding College Card Agreements, defining a college affinity card as a credit card issued in partnership with an institution of higher education. The creditor may donate a portion of the proceeds, offer discounted terms, or display the institution's name or logo on the credit card. The term 'college student credit card account' refers to a credit card account for a college student, defined as a full-time or part-time student at an institution of higher education. Creditors must submit annual reports to the Board detailing the terms and conditions of their business, marketing, and promotional activities. The annual reports must include details of all agreements related to college student credit cards issued by institutions of higher education or affiliated organizations. This includes any memorandums of understanding between creditors, institutions, alumni associations, or foundations. The annual reports must detail agreements related to college student credit cards, including payment amounts, agreement terms, and the number of accounts opened and outstanding. The Comptroller General of the United States will review annual reports detailing credit card agreements related to college student credit cards. The Comptroller General will review reports from creditors and their marketing practices regarding college affinity card agreements and college student card agreements to assess their impact on credit card debt. A report will be submitted to Congress with findings, conclusions, and recommendations for action. Initial creditor reports must be submitted to the Federal Reserve System within 90 days of the enactment of this Act.
